intro: Tithymalus soongaricus subsp. aristatus, commonly known as the mountain tithymalus, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitats.
